resources.string:
" Repo: https://github.com/dijia1124/PlusPlusBattery 
 Author: @dijia1124 aka goodnic 
 Credits: @shminer aka bybycode 
 This app displays the following battery information:
 - Battery Level: The current battery level as a percentage.
 - Status: The current status of the battery (Charging, Discharging, Full, Not Charging).
 - Temperature: The current battery temperature in degrees Celsius.
 - Health: The current health of the battery (Good, Overheat, Dead, Unknown).
 - Voltage: The current battery voltage in millivolts.
 - Charge Cycle Count: The number of charge cycles the battery has gone through.
 - Battery Current: The instantaneous battery current in milliamperes.
 - Full Charge Capacity: The estimated full charge capacity of the battery in milliampere-hours.
 The Full Charge Capacity is displayed when charge complete.
 Charge complete only happens when Battery Level is charged to 100% and Battery Current is within the range from 0 to 20 mA.
 - Root Mode (OnePlus + ColorOS15/OxygenOS15 exclusive):
 - Full Charge Capacity (battery_fcc): Value read by cat /sys/class/oplus_chg/battery/battery_fcc.
 - Battery Health (battery_soh): Value read by cat /sys/class/oplus_chg/battery/battery_soh.
 - Battery Under-Voltage Threshold (vbat_uv): Value read by cat /sys/class/oplus_chg/battery/vbat_uv.
 The device shuts down if the voltage is lower than this threshold.
 - Battery Manufacture Date (battery_manu_date): Value read by cat /sys/class/oplus_chg/battery/battery_manu_date.
 - Qmax refers to the chemical capacity of the battery. The value of this capacity is load independent. This is the capacity that can be released by a battery under very low load current, usually expressed in mAh.
 "

This value is estimated when charge is full (100%) and the current is less than 25 mA. The charge counter is then recorded as estimated full charge capacity and displayed here. \nNote that the battery current multiplier and dual battery option above need to be correctly selected.

\nThis value might show \"Unknown\" if battery_fcc equals to design_capacity, or battery_soh equals to 100%, as the actual compensated value might exceed maximum, causing the raw value to be inaccurate.\n
Raw fcc&soh in Plus Plus Battery are calculated using this table\n
Please select the entries you want to show in the battery monitor:

Disable battery optimization to make the monitor service work properly. For ColorOS 15, enabling auto-launch for this app in system settings might also be necessary to pause the monitor service when screen-off and resume when screen-on.
Only takes effect in root mode. Non-root mode is limited to no shorter than the oem-set interval.
Setting the refresh interval too low may cause unnecessary battery drain.

Please connect your device to a charger while the battery level is not full (less than 100%)… \nIf data is not showing correctly or nothing shows up, the logcat of your model may have not been supported by Plus Plus Battery yet, or the logcat does not contain battery related information.

This feature requires a specific BatteryManager API. If the value shows "-1" or "5" all the time, it means it may not be supported on your device. This can happen on Android versions below 14 or, in some cases, on a few devices running Android 14 and even newer.

If this value is less than 10 mV, your device might be reporting battery voltage in V (volt) instead of mV (millivolt), which also leads to the incorrect battery power value. With root access, OPlus devices may get the correct voltage

By default, charge cycles are recorded when the app is opened. You may need to switch between the Dashboard and History tabs to trigger it.\n\nAlternatively, you can enable the \'Automatic daily charge cycle log\' option in Settings for it to be recorded automatically by WorkManager without manually opening the app.
